content.question: The system shown above consists of two identical blocks that are suspended using four cords, each of a different length. Which of the following claims are true about the magnitudes of the tensions in the cords? Select two answers.

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1, times, cosine of 30 degrees, equals T sub 2, times, cosine of 60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="T sub 3 is greater than T sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1, plus T sub 2, equals T sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 1, times, cosine of 30 degrees, equals T sub 2, times, cosine of 60 degrees" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>60</mn><mi>°</mi></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
